data.sentence: The word لَا comes from the root ل ا and is associated with the meanings:

data.meanings: to know/perceive/understand, to acquaint, perceive by senses.. make verses, remark, poetry, poet, verse, art of poetry, feeling, knowledge.. Sirius, which was worshipped by the Arabs in Pagan times.. mark/marker/signs/rites/symbols/observances/ceremonies/practices, the obligatory ordinances/statutes of God.. a place where a thing is known to be.. measure of length.. sheep/goat.. hair, innermost garment.. trees.. a sign of people in war and in a journey, a call or cry by means of which to know another, banner.. mash'ar al-Haram - holy mosque in Muadhalifah (a place which lies between Makkah and Arafat, six miles from Kabah). The name Mash'ar al-Haram is a compound of Mash'ar meaning the place of perception or knowledge and Haram meaning sacred. Ash'ara to make anyone understand, make known to.
data.sentence: The word يَشْعُرُونَ comes from the root ش ع ر and is associated with the meanings: to know/perceive/understand, to acquaint, perceive by senses.. make verses, remark, poetry, poet, verse, art of poetry, feeling, knowledge.. Sirius, which was worshipped by the Arabs in Pagan times.. mark/marker/signs/rites/symbols/observances/ceremonies/practices, the obligatory ordinances/statutes of God.. a place where a thing is known to be.. measure of length.. sheep/goat.. hair, innermost garment.. trees.. a sign of people in war and in a journey, a call or cry by means of which to know another, banner.. mash'ar al-Haram - holy mosque in Muadhalifah (a place which lies between Makkah and Arafat, six miles from Kabah). The name Mash'ar al-Haram is a compound of Mash'ar meaning the place of perception or knowledge and Haram meaning sacred. Ash'ara to make anyone understand, make known to.

data.meanings: Proposition which points to cause, space or time. In, into, amongst, in company with, during, with, of, for, for the sake of, upon, concerning, after, in comparison, about, among, on account of, respecting, by the side of, on, by, against, according to, in respect of.
data.sentence: The word فِي comes from the root ف ي and is associated with the meanings: Proposition which points to cause, space or time. In, into, amongst, in company with, during, with, of, for, for the sake of, upon, concerning, after, in comparison, about, among, on account of, respecting, by the side of, on, by, against, according to, in respect of.
The word بَلْ comes from the root ب ل and is associated with the meanings:

data.meanings: Be possessed of good, to do good, give one a choice or option (and also be given a choice or option), prefer one thing or person over another thing or person, preferred/pronounced/chosen, strive to surpass one in goodness, excellent in beauty and disposition, to be ideal (show actual or potential usefulness or benefit), be desired in all circumstances and by every person, exalted in rank or quality or reputation, to be better than another person or thing, be the best of things or people, to be generous (possess and show generosity), possess nobility or eminence, be elevated in state or condition.
data.sentence: The word الْخَيْرَاتِ comes from the root خ ي ر and is associated with the meanings: Be possessed of good, to do good, give one a choice or option (and also be given a choice or option), prefer one thing or person over another thing or person, preferred/pronounced/chosen, strive to surpass one in goodness, excellent in beauty and disposition, to be ideal (show actual or potential usefulness or benefit), be desired in all circumstances and by every person, exalted in rank or quality or reputation, to be better than another person or thing, be the best of things or people, to be generous (possess and show generosity), possess nobility or eminence, be elevated in state or condition.

data.meanings: to hasten, be quick, swift/prompt/sudden, strive with one another.
data.sentence: The word نُسَارِعُ comes from the root س ر ع and is associated with the meanings: to hasten, be quick, swift/prompt/sudden, strive with one another.
